question: 出所
sourceMnemonic:
You <kanji>exit</kanji> a <kanji>place</kanji>. It's a <vocabulary>release from prison</vocabulary> for you!

<ja>出所</ja> commonly refers to leaving or being released from facilities ending in <ja>所</ja>, particularly <ja>刑務所</ja> (prisons). It can also mean <vocabulary>source</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>origin</vocabulary> in a slightly formal tone, often used in discussions of copyright to specify the origin of cited information, images, or content.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
The reading follows on'yomi protocols, but you just have to be careful of the shortened <ja>しゅつ</ja> which becomes <ja>しゅっ</ja>.

Note: There is also the reading <reading><ja>でどころ</ja></reading> for the meanings <vocabulary>origin</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>source</vocabulary>. This version is generally used in spoken language, often to emphasize the significance or curiosity about where something came from.
